item.title: GRB 250702BDE
item.description: GRB 250702BDE was a series of three distinct ultra-long extragalactic gamma-ray bursts (GRB) discovered by the Fermi Gamma-ray Space Telescope on July 2, 2025. GRB 250702B, the first event, is the longest duration gamma-ray burst ever discovered. The event consisted of three repeated GRB events (250702B, 250702D, and 250702E) lasting several hours from the same astronomical source, implying potential periodicity within the progenitor system.
